oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Photomontage of Nashville residences, the garden at the Sam Davis home, a historic document, an illustration of a Nashville artist, an Episocopal church, and its first bishop's tomb. Nashville Banner, 1932 May 29.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Davis, Sam; Zeigler, Frank W.; Washington, George; Taylor, Jonathan; Cox, Bertie N.; Cox, Cox, Neel E.; Otey, James Hervey; Hovey, C. M.; Cagle, Charles; Werm, Gaston
Nashville Banner
Houses; Gardens; Tombs & sepulchral monuments; Documents; Churches
Nashville (Tenn.)--History--Sources; Nashville (Tenn.)--Social life and customs; Nashville and Davidson County (Tenn.)--History--Sources
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Photomontage of a Nashville residence on Crescent Road, the garden at the Sam Davis home, a historic document signed by George Washington, an illustration of a Nashville artist, St John's Episocopal Church at Ashwood in Maury County and its first bishop's tomb, and Rock Terrace, another Nashville residence on Woodmont Boulevard, designed by Warfield and Keeble. 16 x 21.5 in. Forms part of the Nashville Newspaper Rotogravure Digital Images Collection.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Wiles
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:publisher: Metropolitan Nashville/Davidson County Archives, Nashville Public Library
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:relation: Nashville Newspaper Rotogravure Digital Images Collection.
